H0.text: Endoskeleton is the calcareous structure developed by pigment cells and composed of ossicles found in echinoderms, exemplified by sea stars and sand dollars.

H1.text: Hydrostatic skeleton is the calcareous structure developed by pigment cells and made of ossicles, exemplified by sea stars and sand dollars in echinoderms.

H2.text: Exoskeleton is the calcareous structure developed by pigment cells and made of ossicles, exemplified by sea stars and sand dollars, that echinoderms have.

H3.text: Thorax is the calcareous structure developed by pigment cells and made of ossicles in echinoderms, exemplified by sea stars and sand dollars.

A4.text: Echinoderms have a mesodermal skeleton in the dermis, composed of calcite-based plates known as ossicles, which form a porous structure known as stereom.

A5.text: Echinoderms have a dermal calcite endoskeleton known as ossicles.
